title: ** Remaining t206 scraps now in Brockelman Auctions ending 6/2!  Prices lowered!! **
author: shammus

posts.post_title: ** Remaining t206 scraps now in Brockelman Auctions ending 6/2!  Prices lowered!! **
posts.post_content:
I have quite a few scraps available for sale or I’d trade generously for t204 or e107 HOFers....

Stahl SGC AUT BLANK BACK – Likely a unique card...I don’t believe there are any other blank back Stahls in existance! Super clean back with no wrinkling wear on the card.  Card is in great overall condition! -- $1100

Starr SGC AUT Triple Ghost image - Nice oversized, wavy border, card has a triple struck magenta image of Starr on front that’s actually printed into the wide border! – $900

Burns SGC AUT Wild Scrap – A lot went wrong with this one! Partial name at top... part of the next card’s border is on front lower right.... reverse image way offset on right...oversized borders.  Some back damage too unfortunately.  A very unique and dramatic card! – $1100

Rossman SGC AUT - Huge strange high blue eyebrows due to a color pass missing it’s mark.  It’s also missing a separate color pass altogether and has uneven, oversized borders –- $900

McLean SGC AUT – oversized wavy borders.  Very nice in terms of condition, very little wear or wrinkling – $225

Marshall Scrap w/ a different card’s background – The green background of the t206 Hunter somehow got printed upside down on this card!  Including a scan of a Hunter card for reference. Wavy oversized borders.  Very neat card with an extremely unique printing goof – $1100

Ganzel – Wavy uneven borders missing the orange and flesh colored color passes.  Notice the all-white skin!  Clear, sharp photo with vivid red coloring instead of the orange background – $900

Griffith “Underprint” - The Griffith was originally part of a puzzle that when put together displays an ad for Oaks Tobacco. On this example, you can see part of a hand, 2 sets of acorns and another symbol that were underprinted on the card’s back before the actual card back was printed over the top of it. There are a few other examples out there however, this sort of an "underprint" does not come up too often. The 1909 tobacco ad for "Oaks Tobacco" was originally printed while t206's where printed at American litho in NYC. --- Asking $400

I also have a Marquard Piedmont 350 PSA 3 available.  No creasing...mild touches to corners --- $140 [SOLD!!]

Scans are all below but let me know if you need others.  Thanks much!
-Brian
[url]redmaccie@hotmail.com[/url]

great cards my brother!  scraps are so unique....the are "one of a kind" cards there.......snow flakes:D

more than likely they are the only ones known to exist.....unique in there own little way....

who knew over a hundred years ago, a printer would grab a "mistake sheet" or blank sheet and set the presses up with garbage sheets inadvertently creating mini works of art...

these are definetly scrap and not crap:D


good luck with the sale.....if any collectors wants to set there collection apart pick up one example of one of these....


the Griffith is so cool !!!!  tying the period advertising and tying it into other issues/ads like the oaks tobacky :cool:  kind of like the bitters lash ads, or the Tolstoi men of history magenta back prints

really neat advanced stuff


neat cards! I would know;)
Thanks buddy!  Good to hear from you and I appreciate all the kind words and you taking the time to write :)
